adjectives.description: suscipient (comparative more suscipient, superlative most suscipient)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) One who takes or admits; one who receives.
examples: But if the sacrament does not do - its work alone , but per modum - recipientis, according to the predispositions of the suscipient , then because infants can neither hinder it nor do any thing to further it , it does them no benefit at all
